description: This program will execute an RFI strategy as can be created with the RFI gui and executes it on one or several   observations.

parameters.name: msname
parameters.info: Name of MS to be flagged

parameters.name: channels
parameters.info: channel selection: single number or start:end[:step] to select channels start through end-1, or start~end[:step] to select channels start through end, with an optional stepping.

parameters.name: timeslots
parameters.info: timeslot selection: single number or start:end to select timeslots start through end-1, or start~end to select timeslots start through end.

parameters.name: timeslot-multiplier
parameters.info: multiplies the timeslot numbers given to -T by the given factor.

parameters.name: corrs
parameters.info: correlation selection. Use comma-separated list of correlation indices.

parameters.name: stations
parameters.info: station (=antenna) selection. Use comma-separated list of station indices.

parameters.name: ifrs
parameters.info: interferometer selection.

parameters.name: ddid
parameters.info: DATA_DESC_ID selection. Single number, or comma-separated list.

parameters.name: field
parameters.info: FIELD_ID selection. Single number, or comma-separated list.

parameters.name: taql
parameters.info: Additional TaQL selection to restrict subset. Selection by data value

parameters.name: above
parameters.info: select on abs(data)>X

parameters.name: below
parameters.info: select on abs(data)<X

parameters.name: nan
parameters.info: select on invalid data (NaN or infinite)

parameters.name: fm-above
parameters.info: select on mean(abs(data))>X, where mean is over frequencies

parameters.name: fm-below=X
parameters.info: select on mean(abs(data))<X, where mean is over frequencies

parameters.name: column
parameters.info: data column for --above/--below/--nan options.

parameters.name: data-flagmask
parameters.info: flags to apply to data column (when e.g. computing mean). Default is ALL. See below for details on specifying flags.

parameters.name: flagged-any
parameters.info: Selects if any of the specified flags are raised. For this and all other options taking a FLAGS argument, FLAGS can be a flagset name or an integer bitmask (if bitflags are in use -- see also the -l/--list option). Prefix the bitmask by '0x' to use hex. Append a '+L' to include legacy boolean FLAG/FLAG_ROW columns. Use 'all' for all bitflags, and 'ALL' for all bitflags plus legacy flags (equivalent to 'all+L'). FLAGS may also be a comma-separated list of any of the above terms.

parameters.name: flagged-all
parameters.info: Selects if all of the specified flags are raised

parameters.name: flagged-none
parameters.info: Selects if none of the specified flags are raised

parameters.name: extend-all-corr
parameters.info: Apply selection to all correlations if at least one is selected

parameters.name: flag
parameters.info: Raise the specified FLAGS

parameters.name: unflag
parameters.info: Clear the specified flags

parameters.name: fill-legacy
parameters.info: Fills legacy FLAG/FLAG_ROW columns using the specified FLAGS. When -f/--flag or -u/--unflag or -r/--remove is used, legacy flags are implicitly reset using all bitflags: use '-g -' to skip this step. You may also use this option on its own to reset legacy flags (within the specified data subset) using some bitmask. Use '-g 0' to clear legacy flags. -c, --create for -f/--flag option only: if a named flagset doesn't exist, creates it. Without this option, an error is reported.

parameters.name: list
parameters.info: lists various info about the MS, including its flagsets.

parameters.name: stats
parameters.info: prints per-flagset flagging stats.

parameters.name: remove
parameters.info: Unflags and removes named flagset(s). You can use a comma-separated list.

parameters.name: export
parameters.info: exports all flags to flag file. FILENAME may end with .gz to produce a gzip-compressed file. If any flagging actions are specified, these will be done before the export.

parameters.name: import
parameters.info: Imports flags from flag file. If any flagging actions are specified, these will be done after the import.

parameters.name: verbose
parameters.info: Verbosity level for messages. Higher is more verbose

parameters.name: timestamps
parameters.info: adds timestamps to verbosity messages.

parameters.name: chunk-size
parameters.info: Number of rows to process at once. Set to higher values if you have RAM to spare.
